methodology.title: Compliance Score Methodology
methodology.description: Understand how your compliance score is calculated, what factors influence it, and how our grading system works. Full transparency into every metric.
methodology.howItWorksP1: Your compliance score is calculated based on the status of your compliance assessments across six regulatory modules. Each module is weighted according to its regulatory significance under the EU Space Act (COM(2025) 335).
methodology.howItWorksP2: For each module, individual scoring factors are evaluated based on your assessment data. These factors are weighted and combined to produce a module score (0–100). The overall score is a weighted average of all module scores.
methodology.howItWorksP3: The score updates in real-time as you complete assessments, upload documents, and update compliance statuses.
methodology.gradeADesc: Score 90–100. Substantially compliant across all modules. Minor refinements may be recommended.
methodology.gradeBDesc: Score 80–89. Strong compliance posture with some areas for improvement.
methodology.gradeCDesc: Score 70–79. Basic compliance met but significant improvements recommended.
methodology.gradeDDesc: Score 60–69. Multiple compliance gaps identified. Remediation required before regulatory review.
methodology.gradeFDesc: Score 0–59. Critical gaps in compliance. Immediate action required.
methodology.criticalFactorsDesc: Some scoring factors are marked as critical. If any critical factor scores 0 points (i.e. is completely unaddressed), the module status is automatically set to non-compliant regardless of the total score. This ensures that essential regulatory requirements cannot be bypassed by high scores in other areas.
methodology.recommendationsP1: Based on your module scores and individual factor assessments, the system generates prioritized recommendations. These are ranked by regulatory impact and urgency:
methodology.priorityCriticalDesc: Addresses a critical compliance gap that could result in regulatory action or authorization denial.
methodology.priorityHighDesc: Important gap that should be addressed promptly to maintain compliance posture.
methodology.priorityMediumDesc: Improvement opportunity that would strengthen overall compliance.
methodology.dataSourcesDesc: Compliance scores are calculated from the following data sources in your account:
methodology.dsAssessments: Module assessments — status of individual requirements within each compliance module
methodology.dsDocuments: Document vault — uploaded evidence, certificates, and compliance documentation
methodology.dsArticleTracker: Article tracker — status of individual EU Space Act articles applicable to your operator type
methodology.dsWorkflows: Authorization workflows — progress through the authorization application process
methodology.dsIncidents: Incident reports — reported security incidents and their resolution status
methodology.dsTimeline: Timeline deadlines — upcoming regulatory deadlines and milestone completion
methodology.disclaimerText: Compliance scores are calculated based on self-assessment data provided by the organization and do not constitute a formal regulatory audit or legal opinion. Scores are indicative and intended to support internal compliance management. For official compliance certification, consult with your designated National Competent Authority (NCA) or legal advisor.
